009package imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.project;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse.GeometricEllipse;
015import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
016
017
018/**
019 * <p>
020 * Calculates the closest point on the ellipse for a given 2D point inside or
021 * outside the ellipse, using orthogonal projection of points onto the ellipse.
022 * This is a robust algorithm based on [1]. See Sec.11.2.2 (Alg. 11.9) of [2]
023 * for details. In contrast to the Newton-based algorithm (see
024 * {@link OrthogonalEllipseProjectorNewton}, this version uses the bisection
025 * method for root finding and returns valid results for points close to the x-
026 * and y-axis but requires significantly more iterations to converge.
027 * </p>
028 * <p>
029 * [1] D. Eberly: "Distance from a point to an ellipse, an ellipsoid, or a
030 * hyperellipsoid", Technical Report, Geometric Tools, www.geometrictools.com,
031 * Redmont, WA (June 2013). <br>
032 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
033 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
034 * </p>
035 * 
036 * @author WB
037 * @version 2022/04/09
038 * @see OrthogonalEllipseProjectorNewton
039 * @see ConfocalConicEllipseProjector
040 */
041public class OrthogonalEllipseProjector extends EllipseProjector {
042        
043        private static final int MaxIterations = 150;
044        private static final double Epsilon = 1e-6;
045        
046        private final double ra, rb, rab;
047        private int lastIterationCount = 0;     // number of root-finding iterations performed in last projection
048        
049        public OrthogonalEllipseProjector(GeometricEllipse ellipse) {
050                super(ellipse);
051                this.ra = ellipse.ra;
052                this.rb = ellipse.rb;
053                this.rab = sqr(ra / rb);        // ratio of squared axes lengths
054        }
055        
056        @Override
057        protected double[] projectCanonical(double[] u1) {
058                // coordinates of p (mapped to first quadrant of canonical coordinates)
059                final double u = u1[0]; // u,v are both positive
060                final double v = u1[1];
061                
062                double[] ub = null;     // the ellipse contact point (in canonical coordinates)
063                lastIterationCount = 0;
064                
065                if (v > 0) {
066                        if (u > 0) {
067                                double uu = u / ra;
068                                double vv = v / rb;
069                                double ginit = sqr(uu) + sqr(vv) - 1;
070                                if (!isZero(ginit)) {
071                                        double s = getRoot(uu, vv, ginit);
072                                        ub = new double[] {rab * u / (s + rab), v / (s + 1)};
073                                }
074                                else {
075                                        ub = new double[] {u, v};
076                                }
077                        }
078                        else {  // u = 0
079                                ub = new double[] {0, rb};
080                        }
081                }       
082                else {  // v = 0
083                        double numer0 = ra * u;
084                        double denom0 = sqr(ra) - sqr(rb);
085                        if (numer0 < denom0) {
086                                double xde0 = numer0 / denom0;
087                                ub = new double[] {ra * xde0, rb * Math.sqrt(1 - sqr(xde0))};
088                        }
089                        else {
090                                ub = new double[] {ra, 0};
091                        }
092                }
093                return ub;
094        }
095
096        // Find the root of function
097        // G(s) = [(rab * uu) / (s + rab)]^2 + [vv / (s + 1)]^2 - 1
098        // using the bisection method.
099        private double getRoot(double uu, double vv, double g0) {
100                double s0 = vv - 1;
101                double s1 = (g0 < 0) ? 0 : Math.hypot(rab * uu, vv) - 1;
102                double s = 0;
103                
104                int i;
105                for (i = 0; i < MaxIterations; i++) {
106                        s = (s0 + s1) / 2;
107                        if (Arithmetic.equals(s, s0) || Arithmetic.equals(s, s1)) {
108                                break;
109                        }
110                        double g = sqr((rab * uu)/(s + rab)) + sqr(vv/(s + 1)) - 1; // = G(s)
111                        if (g > Epsilon) {                      // G(s) is positive
112                                s0 = s;
113                        }
114                        else if (g < -Epsilon) {        // G(s) is negative
115                                s1 = s;
116                        }
117                        else {                                          // G(s) ~ 0 (done)
118                                break;
119                        }
120                }
121                if (i >= MaxIterations) {
122                        throw new RuntimeException(this.getClass().getSimpleName() + 
123                                        ": max. iteration count exceeded");
124                }
125                lastIterationCount = i;
126                return s;
127        }
128        
129        // for statistics only
130        public int getLastIterationCount() {
131                return this.lastIterationCount;
132        }
133
134}
